short-title.#text:
Valley View Ferry Preservation Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The Valley View Ferry is the oldest
			 continuously operated ferry west of the Appalachian Mountains and the third
			 oldest in the United States.

The vessel utilized by the Valley View
			 Ferry, the vessel

fraction.#tail: inch diameter cables that guide the vessel to each side of the river.

italic.#tail:
, does not have steering
			 capabilities; instead, it is attached to 2 overhead,

text.#text:
The crossing distance for the Valley View
			 Ferry is approximately 500 feet.

The Valley View Ferry is located on the
			 Kentucky River between the cities of Lexington, Nicholasville, and Richmond in
			 Central Kentucky.

italic.#tail:
is a 24-ton
			 vessel that is 60 feet long and 14 feet wide.

text.#text:
The Valley View Ferry does not carry
			 vehicles with combustible materials.

The Valley View Ferry is a toll-free
			 ferry.

Federal regulations changed in 2006, which
			 established a new requirement that the Valley View Ferry comply with all Coast
			 Guard inspection and licensing regulations.

The new licensing regulations for operators
			 of the vessel

italic.#tail:
threaten to close the historic
			 ferry.

should maintain
			 safety inspection authority with respect to the Valley View Ferry, licensing
			 authority should reside with the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
